root: ^We're sorry you're having issues with VRCFT. Let's try resolve them!
^To start, which of these symptoms best describes your issue?
^My avatar does not react to my face movements

software: ^This appears to be a software problem.
^Is the name and ID of your avatar detected and displayed on the home page correctly?
publicavatar: ^Does VRCFT work as intended when you're using a community-made public avatar?

c-0: ^This sounds like an issue with the avatar itself. If this is your avatar,

osc: ^Are you utilizing multiple OSC applications at the same time?
multipleoscapps: ^Until OSCQuery support is implemented into VRCFT, we recommend using an OSC router such as VOR.

s: ^VIVE Pro Eye w/ VIVE Facial Tracker

c-3: ^Hmm, I'm not sure how to troubleshoot this headset.

sranipal: ^Now, before anything else, have you installed the SRanipal runtime? This is a separate download from VRCFT and can be found in the VRCFT docs or on VIVE's website.

c-1: ^Please ensure you download the runtime first.
^You can find the download link on the VRCFT wiki

c-0: ^After relaunching VRCFT, does your hardware show up?
c-1: ^Please refer to the troubleshooting instructions and try again

badadapter: ^This sounds like a problem with your usb-c to usb adapter.
^Please ensure you use a high quality one.
faultycable: ^Hmm, it sounds like your hardware is having trouble maintaining a connection to your computer.
^To troubleshoot this, try plugging your Facial Tracker's usb-c cable directly into the computer and try again
^It works when plugged directly into the computer

c-0: ^I hate to be the bearer of bad news, but this is a classic symptom of a faulty headset cable.
^This is a common issue with the VIVE Pro Eye, and a new cable should be sourced to resolve the issue.
^You may also use a long usb extender, but this is up to your descretion.
c-1: ^Are you absolutely sure you have the SRanipal Runtime installed?
^You can check by looking for a little robot icon in your taskbar.
^The robot has green or orange eyes

badhardware: ^This sounds like your tracking hardware might be faulty. Please consult your hardware's manufacturer for guidance.
meta: ^I don't know how to help with the quest pro yet!
discord: ^Please wait for a member of the community to help!
ending: ^Wonderful! Glad to hear your issues are solved. Have fun!
